channel.title: Posts on James Moriarty
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on James Moriarty

item.title: TCP Anycast Shift
item.description: What happens when the routing changes for a stateful network protocol and arrives at another device?

item.title: Docker and DLNA
item.description: I’ve recently discovered the Docker network macvlan driver. It’s a very lightweight driver, because rather than using any Linux bridging or port mapping, it connects container interfaces directly to host interfaces.

item.title: Consulting SRE Engagements
item.description: This post is dedicated to how I would shape a “consulting” style Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) engagement.

item.title: Apex Domain HTTPS Redirect
item.description: I recently broke the apex domain HTTPS redirect to my sub-domain.

item.title: Kubernetes and DLNA
item.description: These are some notes taken while deploying a Digital Living Network Alliance (DLNA) to Kubernetes.

item.title: Kubernetes DIY Dynamic DNS Operator
item.description: I’ve rolled my own Dynamic DNS Operator with Kubernetes CronJob, kubectl, and External DNS.

item.title: Go Public Service Announcement
item.description: Proxy support for some Go applications is being unintentionally dropped with a simple change.

item.title: HTTP Connect By Example
item.description: HTTP CONNECT is used to establish a tunnel. Tunnels are commonly used to create an end-to-end virtual connection, through one or more proxies, which can then be secured using TLS (Transport Layer Security).

item.description: My work often involves restricted private networks often found in large enterprises.

item.title: Game Exploit Retrospective
item.description: I recently dedicated some time to explore the software security space and gain some hands-on experience through exercises like developing game exploits.
